meanings.definition: The state or quality of being transient.
meanings.sent1: The transiencies of life remind us to cherish each moment.
meanings.sent2: She reflected on the transiencies of childhood as she watched her own children grow up.
meanings.sent3: The transiencies of the weather made planning a picnic quite challenging.
meanings.sent4: The artist captured the transiencies of nature in a breathtaking painting.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset highlighted the transiencies of the day.

meanings.sent1: The museum displayed various transiencies from different time periods.
meanings.sent2: The transiencies in the room indicated a diverse collection of items.
meanings.sent3: The transiencies on the shelves caught the eye of the curious child.
meanings.sent4: The transiencies of the market included fruits, vegetables, and flowers.
meanings.sent5: The transiencies of the crowd added to the lively atmosphere of the event.
